results.description: Use short-term returns as a momentum signal. Applied SUGGESTION1 partially (single strong datafield mcr38_last for simplicity); SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector field used); SUGGESTION3 not applied (coverage 0.9796 > 0.6); SUGGESTION4 applied by selecting a high userCount/alphaCount field (mcr38_last userCount 238, alphaCount 1943). Confidence set to 0.65 because short momentum is common but noisy.

Momentum on 5-day returns filtered by rising volume. S1 applied (two datafields: mcr38_last + mcr38_volume); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed (both coverages >0.97); S4 applied (mcr38_volume high userCount). Confidence 0.7 reflecting extra confirmation from volume.

Short-term overreaction mean-reversion using percent change. S1: single datafield (mcr38_percent_change) used for clarity; S2 not applicable; S3 not applied (coverage 0.9796); S4: field has high alphaCount (625). Confidence 0.6 as reversion can work intraday/short-term.

Trade when ADX signals are strong: use ADX strength to bias return signal. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_strength + mcr38_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed (coverage ADX strength 0.9596); S4 ADX fields have high alphaCount. Confidence 0.68 due to ADX usefulness for trend detection.

Exploit low BB strength followed by percent change reversion. S1 applied (mcr38_bb_strength + mcr38_percent_change); S2 not applicable; S3 not applied (coverage >0.94); S4 bb_strength userCount 105 moderate. Confidence 0.55 (lower due to fewer alphas on bb_strength).

Use long-term percent to filter medium-term momentum: prefer trades aligned with long-term. S1 applied (mcr38_longterm_percent + mcr38_change); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 longterm_percent has decent alphaCount. Confidence 0.7 for directional alignment reducing noise.

Weight momentum by overall strength_rating to prefer robust signals. S1 applied (mcr38_strength_rating + mcr38_last); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 strength_rating has userCount 107. Confidence 0.66.
Open mean-reversion when 1-day change is extreme (winsorize then reverse). S1 single datafield (mcr38_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 mcr38_change high alphaCount. Confidence 0.62.
Use MACD 20/50 strength to amplify medium-term returns. S1 applied (mcr38_macd_20_50_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 macd field alphaCount moderate. Confidence 0.67.

Signal when short MA_20 is stronger than MA_100 via strengths difference combined with returns. S1 applied (mcr38_ma_20_strength + mcr38_ma_100_strength); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 both MA strength fields have adequate counts. Confidence 0.64.

Trade when short-term and long-term percent signals diverge (mean-reversion lean). S1 applied (mcr38_shorttermpercent + mcr38_longterm_percent); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 both percent fields available. Confidence 0.6 because divergence often signals reversion.
Continue direction when returns positive and volume spikes. S1 applied (mcr38_percent_change + mcr38_volume); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 mcr38_volume has high userCount. Confidence 0.66.
Use CCI_60 strength to weight 10-day returns. S1 applied (mcr38_cci_60_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 cci_60_strength alphaCount strong (897). Confidence 0.69.

Bias trades by trendspotter strength to reduce false signals. S1 applied (mcr38_trendspotter_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 trendspotter_strength alphaCount moderate. Confidence 0.66.
Use daily high-low range to detect breakouts (higher range = momentum). S1 applied (mcr38_high + mcr38_low); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 both fields have good coverage. Confidence 0.63.

When MA strengths decline but price rallied, fade the move. S1 applied (mcr38_ma_50_strength + mcr38_percent_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 ma_50_strength has decent counts. Confidence 0.58.

Adjust simple reversal by overall strength rating to avoid weak signals. S1 applied (mcr38_strength_rating + mcr38_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 strength_rating userCount reasonable. Confidence 0.64.
Take momentum trades aligned with ADX direction (strengthening). S1 applied (mcr38_change + mcr38_adx_direction); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 adx_direction coverage high. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Pair: short-term percent gap to medium-term mean
results.description: Use difference between short-term percent and medium-term mean to spot reversion. S1 applied (mcr38_shorttermpercent + mcr38_mediumterm_percent); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 both percent fields available. Confidence 0.61.
Favor momentum where MAHILO strength is high. S1 applied (mcr38_mahilo_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 mahilo_strength counts moderate. Confidence 0.65.

Fade direction when ADX_direction indicates weakening (lower values). S1 applied (mcr38_adx_direction + mcr38_percent_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 adx_direction coverage high. Confidence 0.59.

Trade when strength rating diverges from direction rating (contrarian). S1 applied (mcr38_strength_rating + mcr38_direction_rating); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 both fields have good counts. Confidence 0.56.

Use cross-sectional zscore of 10-day returns for relative momentum. S1 using single field (mcr38_last) to compute cross-section; S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 mcr38_last high alphaCount. Confidence 0.68.
Identify reversals when volume drops and price extreme; uses mcr38_volume and mcr38_percent_change. S1 applied; S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 volume has high userCount. Confidence 0.6.
Use ADX strength to scale breakout returns. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 adx_strength alphaCount high. Confidence 0.7.

When short MACD strength is low but price surges, apply reversal. S1 applied (mcr38_macd_20_50_strength + mcr38_percent_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 macd strength counts moderate. Confidence 0.57.
Combine high-low range and volume spike to find continuation breakouts. S1 applied (mcr38_high - mcr38_low + mcr38_volume); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 volume coverage high. Confidence 0.66.
If last value is recent max over window, favor continuation. S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 mcr38_last strong. Confidence 0.63.

Combine multiple indicator strengths (ADX + MACD) averaged to form confidence. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_strength + mcr38_macd_20_100_strength); used two fields; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 both have good counts. Confidence 0.68.
Use zscore of percent change over recent window as signal. S1 single field mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.64.
Robust mean-reversion using winsorized percent change to avoid outliers. S1 single mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 high coverage. Confidence 0.62.

Scale momentum by trendspotter_direction (strengthening vs weakening). S1 applied (mcr38_last + mcr38_trendspotter_direction); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 trendspotter fields moderate. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: MA crossover momentum using signals strengths
results.description: Use MA_20 vs MA_50 strength difference to trigger momentum. S1 applied (mcr38_ma_20_strength + mcr38_ma_50_strength); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 counts modest. Confidence 0.63.
Prefer trades when overall_percent aligns with shorttermpercent. S1 applied (mcr38_overall_percent + mcr38_shorttermpercent); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 both fields available. Confidence 0.62.
Use information ratio of returns over window to favor stable momentum. S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 mcr38_last strong. Confidence 0.7 for IR capturing stability.
Divide recent returns by recent stddev to prefer high Sharpe moves. S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 mcr38_last high alphaCount. Confidence 0.69.
Use PARA_50_strength to confirm breakouts in returns. S1 applied (mcr38_para_50_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 PARA field counts moderate. Confidence 0.66.

Avoid signals from extreme low/high volumes by winsorizing volume before scaling returns. S1 applied (mcr38_last + mcr38_volume); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 volume has high userCount. Confidence 0.65.
If today is recent max over window, fade the move expecting pullback. S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.58.

Use MACD 50/100 strength to favor longer trends for position sizing. S1 applied (mcr38_macd_50_100_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 macd 50/100 strength alphaCount 365. Confidence 0.67.

Use categorical overall_signal encoded as numeric to bias returns (use overall_percent instead if safer). S1 applied (mcr38_overall_percent + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 overall_percent coverage high. Confidence 0.64.
Capture acceleration by taking delta of returns and zscoring. S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.63.
When MAHILO strength strong but trendspotter weak, fade MAHILO signal. S1 applied (mcr38_mahilo_strength + mcr38_trendspotter_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.55.
Use volume as weight on reversal of percent change (higher volume -> stronger signal). S1 applied (mcr38_percent_change + mcr38_volume); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.61.
Signal when price hits recent max (momentum). S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Trend confirmation by PARA and MA strengths
results.description: Require PARA_50_strength and ma_100_strength to both be high to take momentum. S1 applied (mcr38_para_50_strength + mcr38_ma_100_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.
Use gap between shorttermpercent and mediumterm_percent to predict reversion. S1 applied (mcr38_shorttermpercent + mcr38_mediumterm_percent); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.6.
Multiply recent returns by normalized overall strength_rating to size positions. S1 applied (mcr38_last + mcr38_strength_rating); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.67.
Require ADX_direction strengthening and volume spike for momentum. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_direction + mcr38_volume); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Percent change scaled by MA_50 strength
results.description: Use MA_50_strength to scale percent change signal. S1 applied (mcr38_percent_change + mcr38_ma_50_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.63.
If current is recent min, expect bounce (mean-revert). S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.59.
Average longterm_percent and mediumterm_percent to build a smoother trend measure. S1 applied (mcr38_longterm_percent + mcr38_mediumterm_percent); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.
Use MAHILO signal strength to amplify breakouts in price. S1 applied (mcr38_mahilo_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after large one-day move
results.description: Fade very large 1-day percent moves using winsorized reverse signal. S1 single field mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.6.
Bias 15-day momentum by macd_20_100_strength. S1 applied (mcr38_last + mcr38_macd_20_100_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.67.
Short when strength_rating drops but price increases (contrarian). S1 applied (mcr38_strength_rating + mcr38_percent_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.56.
Use zscore of volume to create a normalized volume-momentum overlay. S1 single field mcr38_volume; S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 high userCount. Confidence 0.62.
Compute IR of percent changes to find stable movers. S1 single field mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.68.
If MA_100_strength exceeds MA_20_strength but short-term rallied, fade. S1 applied (mcr38_ma_100_strength + mcr38_percent_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.57.
Combine trendspotter_strength and adx_strength for a robust trend score. S1 applied (mcr38_trendspotter_strength + mcr38_adx_strength); S2 not applicable; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.69.
Measure deviation from recent mean percent change and revert. S1 single field mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Breakout confirmed by PARA and volume
results.description: Require PARA strength and volume spike for breakout continuation. S1 applied (mcr38_para_50_strength + mcr38_volume); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.67.
Use overall_percent percentile (quantile) to select top trend names. S1 single field mcr38_overall_percent; S2 not applicable; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.65.
Detect MACD strength drop while price still rising to flag reversals. S1 applied (mcr38_macd_20_50_strength + mcr38_percent_change); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.58.
If daily high-low range is extremely high, expect short-term reversion. S1 single field mcr38_high and mcr38_low used together (2 fields); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.6.
Apply hump to limit turnover in momentum signal (reduce noisy flips). S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.
If ADX strength trending up, favor momentum continuation. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.68.
If several indicator strengths fall (avg of two strengths), fade recent gains. S1 applied (mcr38_ma_50_strength + mcr38_macd_20_50_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.57.
Winsorize strength before scaling returns to damp outliers. S1 applied (mcr38_strength_rating + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.
Use mahilo_signal (encoded) strength combined with returns for breakout confirmation. S1 applied (mcr38_mahilo_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.64.
Rank 10-day returns cross-sectionally to pick relative winners. S1 single field mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Pair of strengths: MACD vs PARA
results.description: When macd_20_100_strength and para_50_strength disagree, short the weaker signal's direction. S1 applied (mcr38_macd_20_100_strength + mcr38_para_50_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.55.
Use ts_kurtosis of returns to find fat-tail periods and reduce exposure (avoid high kurtosis). S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.6.
Smooth strength signals with ts_mean then scale momentum. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_strength + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.67.
If volume hasn't changed for many days and price stagnates, expect a mean revert. S1 applied (mcr38_volume + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.54 (more experimental).
If strength_rating high, take short-term momentum. S1 applied (mcr38_strength_rating + mcr38_last); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Mean reversion using ts_mean and ts_std_dev
results.description: Zscore of price relative to recent mean/std to spot reversion opportunities. S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.63.
Bucketize overall_percent into groups and trade top bucket momentum. S1 single mcr38_overall_percent; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.65.
Require both mahilo_strength and bb_strength high for breakout continuation. S1 applied (mcr38_mahilo_strength + mcr38_bb_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.62.
Scale recent returns by scaled ADX strength to size positions. S1 applied (mcr38_last + mcr38_adx_strength); S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.68.
If percent_change crosses its ts_mean from below (acceleration), take momentum. S1 single mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.62.
Apply group of two strengths averaged to require consistency before trading. S1 applied (mcr38_ma_100_strength + mcr38_ma_50_strength); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Short-term revert after consecutive positive returns
results.description: If returns over last 3 days are consecutively positive, expect short-term reversion. S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.58.
Divide raw momentum by ts_std_dev of percent_change to favor stable moves. S1 single field mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Trend confirmation by para and macd slow
results.description: Require PARA_50 and MACD_50_100 strengths both high to enter trend trade. S1 applied (mcr38_para_50_strength + mcr38_macd_50_100_strength); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.68.
Use overall_percent > 0.5 to permit momentum trades only when consensus bullish. S1 applied (mcr38_overall_percent + mcr38_last); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Short-term reversal using ts_max_diff and strength
results.description: If price at recent max but strength weak, fade. S1 applied (mcr38_last + mcr38_strength_rating); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.6.
Apply ts_quantile to returns to obtain normalized momentum that is less sensitive to outliers. S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.66.
Fade moves when percent_change extreme but volume low (low conviction). S1 applied (mcr38_percent_change + mcr38_volume); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.61.
Smooth indicator strengths via ts_mean and use as filter for momentum. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_strength + mcr38_macd_20_50_strength); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.67.
When returns exhibit high kurtosis (fat tails), reduce exposure or fade. S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.58.
Winsorize percent_change then take zscore momentum to avoid spikes. S1 single mcr38_percent_change; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Trending names based on combined percent averages
results.description: Average short, medium, and long-term percent signals to form a unified trend score. S1 applied (mcr38_shorttermpercent + mcr38_mediumterm_percent) but use two fields limit; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Confidence 0.68.
Apply linear decay to historical returns to emphasize recent moves while smoothing turnover. S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: ADX + MACD ensemble for aggressive trend
results.description: Multiply ADX strength and MACD 20/100 strength to find strongly confirmed trends. S1 applied (mcr38_adx_strength + mcr38_macd_20_100_strength); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Short-term reversal when overall_signal contradicts returns
results.description: If returns positive but overall_percent indicates sell consensus, fade. S1 applied (mcr38_percent_change + mcr38_overall_percent); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.59.
Favor momentum when returns' recent stddev is low (stable trend). S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.67.
Rank names by ma_50_strength cross-section and take top-ranked momentum stocks. S1 single mcr38_ma_50_strength; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Momentum resilient to outliers via pasteurize
results.description: Apply pasteurize to returns to remove INF/outliers before zscore. S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.64.
If longterm_percent much higher than shorttermpercent, consider contrarian fade to mean. S1 applied (mcr38_longterm_percent + mcr38_shorttermpercent); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.56.
Use both volume spike and ADX direction to confirm moves. S1 applied (mcr38_volume + mcr38_adx_direction); S2 not applied. Confidence 0.68.
If current is recent max (arg_max==0), increase weight of momentum signal. S1 single mcr38_last; S2 not applied. Confidence 0.63.
